Accept no cheap American substitutes!

Ladders - Online Guide</A>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Snakes and Ladders
messages.messageBody:
From: <SandraDodd@...>

<<Here's an online game.

http://www.snakes-and-ladders.com/>>


Thanks Sandra, Joseph and Sierra will love this. I thought it was a joke. I
never heard of snakes and ladders but we play chutes and ladders!!

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Snakes and Ladders
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.bbc.co.uk/schools/numbertime/games/snakes.shtml That one s not as pretty, also an online version, but unlike the last one I sent, you have to move
messages.messageBody:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/schools/numbertime/games/snakes.shtml


That one's not as pretty, also an online version, but unlike the last one I
sent, you have to move your own piece here. It won't let you put it on the
wrong space, but you have to count or add to know what space it DOES go to.

Pretty cool, but it needs shockwave, which my internet explorer has but the
other (netscape) doesn't (on my particular computer).

Of course there are board game versions too, but these are right here!

Sandra

messages.subject: Snakes and Ladders
messages.msgSnippet: Here s an online game. http://www.snakes-and-ladders.com/ I just love snakes and ladders game boards.  Whenever I find a book on the history of games I always
messages.messageBody:
Here's an online game.

http://www.snakes-and-ladders.com/

I just love snakes and ladders game boards. Whenever I find a book on the
history of games I always look at that (and maybe at everything else too
<g>). When you asked, I went to Google, and WOW. I'll be happy for hours
now.

Sandra
<A HREF="http://www.snakes-and-ladders.com/">snakes-and-ladders.com</A>
